text: Narket is a village in Kapurthala district of Punjab State, India. It is located from Kapurthala, which is both district and sub-district headquarters of Narket. The village is administrated by a Sarpanch, who is an elected representative. == Demography == According to the report published by Census India in 2011, Narket has 68 houses with the total population of 398 persons of which 205 are male and 193 females. Literacy rate of Narket is 76.57%, higher than the state average of 75.84%. The population of children in the age group 0–6 years is 48 which is 12.06% of the total population. Child sex ratio is approximately 920, higher than the state average of 846. == Population data == {|class="wikitable sortable" ! Particulars !! Total !!
